channel.title: Pug’s little secret
channel.description:
For those of you who’ve been around for a while, you’ll know that Pug has been in the original set since release, and it sounds like an appregio lead synth, and for some reason to me, it gives a strange retro feeling (I don’t know why, don’t ask-) But I was playing with the settings for a bit, and somehow, I ended up with a completely different sound instrument, but it was still Pug. The thing is, it sounded suspiciously almost like Silk from 7 Skies!
Check it out yourself: https://app.auxy.co/projects/GekfBm6VlcajrEVOHimyrA==

item.title: Pug’s little secret
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
No, not really.
I sucked in high school, but on the other hand, I know DMX and MIDI protocol, audio engineering, and sound design.
I think it’s what you choose to be good at.
I chose everything artistic and nothing school.

Read full topic

item.description:
i swear sound designers have the highest IQ

Read full topic

item.title: Pug’s little secret
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
It’s because Pug is a pluck while Silk is a lead/pad hybrid. They’re both similar in composition, as far as I can tell. Hard to tell with these sampled sounds, as they’re very complicated in waveform.

Read full topic

item.title: Pug’s little secret
item.dc:creator: tornait
item.description:
Almost. Pug sounds way too muted in comparison to Silk. It also has much less sustain overall…

Read full topic

item.title: Pug’s little secret
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Pug is from AP-003, Puppy is from the OG pack.

item.title: Pug’s little secret
item.dc:creator: RazerFireRiot
item.description:
For those of you who’ve been around for a while, you’ll know that Pug has been in the original set since release, and it sounds like an appregio lead synth, and for some reason to me, it gives a strange retro feeling (I don’t know why, don’t ask-)
But I was playing with the settings for a bit, and somehow, I ended up with a completely different sound instrument, but it was still Pug. The thing is, it sounded suspiciously almost like Silk from 7 Skies!

Check it out yourself:
